options.option: implantation of the blastocyst occurs at the endometrium
options.explanation: implantation of the blastocyst in the uterine endometrium in the superior part of the body of the uterus, slightly more often on the posterior wall than on the anterior wall of the uterus. It begins at the end of 1st week and is completed by the end of the 2nd week

options.option: implantation is completed at the end of the 2nd week
the syncythiotrophoblast erodes the endometrium during implantation
the cytrophoblast erodes the endometrial blood vessel
estrogen and progesterone do not play a part in implantation
The endometrial change that occurs during implantation is called decidual reaction
The extraembryonic mesoderm develops from the primary umbilical vesicle
The secondary umbilical vesicle is larger than the primary umbilical vesicle
The amniotic cavity appears as a space superior to the embryoblast
The embryoblast differenciates into trilaminar embryonic disc

Questions.question: The following are true about implantation

options.option: implantation is completed at the end of the 2nd week
options.explanation: begins at the end of 1st week and is completed by the end of the 2nd week

options.option: implantation during a restricted time period 6-10 days after ovulation and fertilization

options.explanation: begins at the end of 1st week and is completed by the end of the 2nd week

options.option: implantation of the blastocyst can be detected by Ultrasonography and highly sensitive radioimmunoassays of hCG as early as the 1st week
options.explanation: implantation of the blastocyst can be detected by Ultrasonography and highly sensitive radioimmunoassays of hCG as early as the end of 2nd week

options.option: implantion occurs in the myometrium in the superior part of the body of the body of the uterus, slightly more often on the posterior wall than on the anterior wall of the uterus
options.explanation: implantion occurs in the endometrium in the superior part of the body of the body of the uterus, slightly more often on the posterior wall than on the anterior wall of the uterus
